level.heading: DETERMINATION OF REQUIRED PAYMENT DATE (ยง 1-1707)

level.text: If a contract specifies the date on which payment is due, the required payment date is the date specified in the contract.
If a contract does not specify a payment date, the required payment date will be one of the following:
Meat and meat food products – the seventh (7th) day after the date of delivery of the meat or meat product;
Perishable agricultural commodities – the tenth (10th) day after the date of delivery of the perishable agricultural commodity; or
All other goods and services – the thirtieth (30th) day after the receipt of a proper invoice by the designated payment officer.
The following rules shall apply in computing required payment dates:
The date of the delivery of meat or meat food products or perishable agricultural commodities, or the date an invoice for other goods and services is received, is not counted;
Days designated as legal holidays in the District of Columbia under D.C. Code ยง 28-2701 (1996 Repl.) are not counted; and
Saturdays and Sundays are counted unless they are legal holidays.
